So much of what we're fighting for is on the ballot this election, including:

üè† Affordable housing
üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è Universal health care
üí∏ Economic justice
üåÖ A #GreenNewDeal
‚ú≥Ô∏è Cannabis legalization
üèô Livable communities
üçè A sustainable food system

We can do it. We must do it. #VOTE

Yet another reason to support @HarrisonJaime for U.S. Senate: his strong support of our bill to ensure half a million local, independent restaurants get the resources they need to make it through the pandemic. #SaveRESTAURANTS
https://t.co/apDL2oY9kz

Terrific strategy session today with Portland chef Greg Higgins about how to create a more sustainable and resilient food system and the importance of our legislation to ensure local, independent restaurants can survive the pandemic. Lots of work ahead. #SaveRESTAURANTS https://t.co/SleK4UUDoX

Given COVID's impact on our economy, it has never been more important to pass transformative solutions to the #HousingCrisis. My plan would address public housing, homelessness, renter relief, equitable home ownership, and fair housing policies. Learn more:https://t.co/BEf9ibXoZy

Hope Trump's team of doctors includes a chiropractor to treat the whiplash from his incoherent and erratic decision making.

COVID relief might be a game to Trump and his fellow Republicans, but it isn't to the millions of American workers and small businesses that need help NOW.
The list of devastating consequences goes on and on. It‚Äôs clear that the only cure for this virus is to vote Trump out.
Because of Trump‚Äôs selfish decision, your child‚Äôs school won‚Äôt get the money they need to ensure safe and effective learning during the pandemic.
Because of Trump‚Äôs short-sighted decision, your state and local governments won‚Äôt get the relief they need and may need to lay-off first responders and health workers that you rely on.
Trump‚Äôs decision means you won't get another $1,200 cash payment. And if you're out of work because of his mismanagement of the pandemic, you won't get supplemental unemployment benefits either.
While Trump gets free world-class COVID-19 treatment in his ivory tower, he just rejected bipartisan #stimulus relief efforts for the rest of the country. Here‚Äôs what this means for you:

Like millions of Americans with COVID-19, Trump now has another pre-existing condition.

If he is successful in overturning the Affordable Care Act in court, all of those people could be denied health insurance.

The Trump admin must drop their lawsuit NOW. #ProtectOurCare

How dare Trump take advantage of taxpayer-funded health care when he‚Äôll be in court immediately after the election to try and rip away health care from 20 MILLION Americans.
https://t.co/SXqleXnwa2

BREAKING: The House just passed our RESTAURANTS Act, a $120 billion lifeline to help 500,000 independent restaurants and their 11 million employees survive the pandemic.

Without it, up to 85% of local restaurants could close forever.

The Senate must join us to #SaveRESTAURANTS.

Don't forget to wear a mask.

[üì∏ credit: Francis Chung] https://t.co/4TPH8uS2TW

The House is preparing to vote on our RESTAURANTS Act, a $120 billion lifeline to help local, independent restaurants and their employees get through the pandemic. Learn more about the fight to #SaveRESTAURANTS‚§µÔ∏è https://t.co/CouW5g3pSt

As I announced today alongside local chefs, our bill to provide $120 billion to independent restaurants struggling to survive the pandemic is in a new relief package.

What started as a Portland effort to #SaveRESTAURANTS is now a national movement. Vote is expected this week! https://t.co/PxOdEJhpCd

Bill Barr and other Trump cronies at DOJ are continuing their tyrannical campaign to prevent Americans from protesting by threatening to pull federal funds from Portland.

Make no mistake: We won't be intimidated by unconstitutional threats or illegal government overreach. https://t.co/KksIgXrRbw

Inspired by @WCKitchen's wildfire relief operation here in Portland. Local chefs like Andrew Garrett and Erika Polmar are saving the world through healthy food served with love and compassion. Meals are destined for the hard hit city of Estacada where hope and help are needed! https://t.co/la5DdiUPuu

Air quality and smoke from the #OregonFires is a major health threat, especially during the pandemic. We're calling on HHS Secretary Azar to immediately declare a public health emergency to ensure Oregon has every resource possible to protect public health.https://t.co/2idtwB2bYR

Today, Portland has the worst air quality in the world. Especially in the midst of the pandemic, we can‚Äôt underestimate these incredibly dangerous conditions. Please stay inside whenever possible. https://t.co/q1Qz6SQP5s

Air quality conditions in Oregon are especially dangerous in the face of the pandemic. Stay informed:

‚ñ∂Ô∏è CDC info on wildfire smoke and COVID-19: https://t.co/EKwmX966xJ

‚ñ∂Ô∏è Local air quality info: https://t.co/FF0YENmiAP

Another telling example of empty boasting, stunning incompetence, & cruelty as @realdonaldtrump threatens to deny badly needed resources to cities hit hard by COVID-19. Rather than working to reduce tensions, he makes situations worse when he's unable to lead or solve problems.

Absent from the RNC:
‚ùéMasks
‚ùéSocial distancing
‚ùéA plan to defeat COVID-19

Present at the RNC:
‚òëÔ∏èRacism
‚òëÔ∏èBigotry 
‚òëÔ∏èLies

We can't afford four more years of Donald Trump.

180,000 Americans have passed away. More than 5.5 million are sick. And millions more are unemployed.

Yet speakers at the RNC are again pretending the pandemic is over.

Clearly, they'll never take this virus seriously. We must vote them out of office and stop the #TrumpChaos.

Just like with COVID, Republicans on the House floor are arguing that Trump's sabotage of our mail system is a hoax. 

Tell that to the 500+ Oregonians who've told me harrowing stories about how mail delays have already created serious problems in their lives.

#SaveThePostOffice

This election truly is a battle for the soul of our nation. And the stakes ‚Äì for our climate, health, economy, and so much more ‚Äì could not be higher.

Congrats Vice President @JoeBiden on becoming our nominee. We're going to do everything we can to send you to the White House. https://t.co/k4mOrfiJnp

Working on various ideas to stop Trump's assault on our mail, including having USPS delay the delivery of junk mail in the weeks leading up to the election and instead prioritize ballots and prescriptions.

The health of our citizens and democracy must come first! 

#SaveUSPS

Trump can‚Äôt win on his failed record, so he‚Äòs trying to destroy our mail system to prevent people from safely voting during a pandemic and steal the election.

House Democrats approved $25 billion for USPS three months ago. Republicans must join us to #SaveUSPS and our democracy. https://t.co/lbnOVEJz35

You've got to ask yourself what planet Republicans live on as they continue to block more COVID relief.

Don‚Äôt they hear constituents' fears? Don‚Äôt they get the economic trauma? How can they ignore the most urgent set of interrelated crises in our history?

People need help NOW!

Trump wants you to think more COVID testing is unnecessary while he is tested daily.

Trump wants you to think #VoteByMail is fraudulent while he does it often.

Trump wants your kid to go back to school while his kid's school stays closed.

We must vote this fraud out of office!

#VoteByMail is no longer just a good idea. It's essential in order to protect our democracy and public health during this pandemic.

I joined Portland Communities and Postal Workers United today to demand an end to partisan attacks on our mail and our vote.https://t.co/0Xpu5iuVzS

Disgraceful. Trump thinks the staggering coronavirus death toll in the United States "is what it is".

Tell that to the hundreds of Oregonians who have lost loved ones in part because of the administration's refusal to take this pandemic seriously. https://t.co/jlxu2XZR0a
The growing number of COVID-19 cases in our nation‚Äôs jails is a human rights crisis. We must take steps NOW to reduce jail populations. Countless lives are at stake. https://t.co/f7l1XlJVgG

As we work to block the use of tear gas in our communities altogether, we need answers from EPA and the Department of Environmental Quality about how these dangerous chemicals impact public health and our environment.

@Karin_Power and I are demanding an immediate investigation‚§µÔ∏è https://t.co/9ATNzNypRC

It's unfathomable that @SenateGOP has allowed $600/week in unemployment insurance to expire.

Millions of Americans are still unemployed because of Trump's disastrous COVID-19 response.

The Senate must join the House in extending this important lifeline.
https://t.co/Ytk1DPI6pm
RT @karin_power: @repblumenauer and I are calling on EPA, DEQ, and others to investigate the public health and enviro risks of tear gas and‚Ä¶

Tear gas, pepper spray & other chemicals that have rained down on Portland endanger our environment and public health.

@Karin_Power and I are calling for an investigation by EPA and the Department of Environmental Quality to understand the full impact of law enforcement actions. https://t.co/XcLGKkEXXG

We can't let Trump's lawless actions distract people from the key reason why Portlanders are protesting: generations of racism and police brutality.

If this president cared about Black lives as much as he did trampling 1st amendment rights, we'd be better off.

#BlackLivesMatter

Today #SCOTUS struck down a discriminatory clinic shutdown law in Louisiana - a major win in our fight for reproductive freedom, health care, and economic justice!  

This is a great victory, but our work isn‚Äôt done. 

#MyRightMyDecision

Trump has waged war against the American citizens he is supposed to be leading. 

From his inadequate response to a global pandemic to stoking racial tensions to an intense high, his incompetence is making our country worse at every turn. 

This has to stop NOW!

The restaurants that make our communities unique have been hit the hardest by #COVID19.

My plan would give immediate relief to local, independent restaurants so they can stay afloat and keep our communities whole. Read about it here ‚¨áÔ∏è
https://t.co/fHBfBj2dw4

Tonight's victory shows that people want to actually solve the crises that we are facing (climate, housing, health care, the economy, etc) & build broad coalitions to do so. 
They are not interested in Twitter talking points that are divisive & devoid of actual policy solutions.

Join @SMeieran, @SenBurdick, and me at 11 AM for a #COVID19 virtual town hall.

We‚Äôre going to discuss the work we‚Äôre doing at the federal, state, and local levels to beat this and come back stronger than ever. 

Watch here: https://t.co/sDw3CBFpyZ https://t.co/dmoCYD71ls

While we fight the #COVID19 crisis, we should begin thinking about the ultimate crisis of our climate & its most devastating impacts. 

On the 50th Anniversary of #EarthDay, let's commit to having the bold vision of a healthy planet & a healthy economy.
https://t.co/bw5rgy6HCN

The U.S. today has effectively given death sentences to hundreds of thousands of non-violent drug offenders trapped in COVID-19 hotspots in our prisons. 

This 4/20, let's commit to staying the course & reforming our harmful cannabis policies.
https://t.co/0dt4E2BSTs
RT @GreerRyan_: BREAKING: 113 Congress members urge moratorium on all utility shut-offs in next #COVID19 package. THANK YOU @SenJeffMerkley‚Ä¶

RT @RepBarragan: #COVID19 relief funds should go to #PeopleNotPolluters.

Today, @SenMarkey & I led a letter w/ 39 colleagues opposing any‚Ä¶

We need a ‚Äútime out‚Äù on rent, mortgage, and commercial leases. I'm fighting for this and more in the next #COVID19 relief package. 

These are troubling times. We need bold action that will make a difference for the challenges people are facing right now.

#VoteByMail was always a good idea. 

Now, it‚Äôs a necessity. 

People should not be forced to choose between their health and participating in our democracy.

Vote-by-mail is no longer just a good idea, it's absolutely necessary. 

We must protect our democracy while still prioritizing public health. 
https://t.co/7mVrMVzkJX

Trump has no issue using the Defense Production Act to build bombs, but when health professionals are in desperate need, it's an unreasonable "last resort.‚Äù 

Our frontline health care workers need PPE now. There's no time to waste.

https://t.co/X2khc5wiLZ

Showing care & concern for society‚Äôs most vulnerable reflects our whole society! https://t.co/kEn3yrtopq

PPE should be prioritized for health care workers, not ICE!
https://t.co/Lwe4tKl14g

Using technology, our COVID-19 Resource Guide, and our campaign infrastructure, we held our first volunteer training today to reach out to at-risk community members to check in with them and connect them to the resources they need. https://t.co/DFHSULy8sI

A salute to our country's heroes...
THANK YOU to the janitors and cleaning crews who are working around the clock to keep hospitals, grocery stores, and offices clean. https://t.co/kUwSk0d4KK
Americans need a coordinated, whole-of-government response to provide healthcare and economic security during the #COVID19 pandemic.

While we work to inform & empower people to use the bill, we must start working on what comes next in a recovery package that builds on and expands on the recovery of our economy and strengthens the healthcare system.

Today‚Äôs package is a welcome sign to the hundreds of thousands of Oregonians I represent who are worried about staying healthy, keeping their job, and paying their bills. 

This bill is by no means perfect, but it's immeasurably better than the Senate‚Äôs initial bill.

A salute to our country's heroes...
THANK YOU to health care workers and support staff who are risking their lives on the frontlines to care for our communities. https://t.co/gIB7WO7nON

Thank you to all our frontline workers and to those supporting their friends, families, and neighbors during this challenging time. My team and I have updated our COVID-19 Resources Guide & added a section in Spanish, which we will continue to add to. https://t.co/5j8VtRHc10

I worked w/ @RepDelBene, @cathymcmorris & other #PNW members to urge the Trump admin to address the growing demand of ventilators in our region, which we severely lack. 

We have been hit hard by #COVID19. We must provide front line physicians w/ resources to keep people safe. https://t.co/eoZPsjM0U3

States are rightly delaying in-person voting, but we shouldn't have to choose between public health and participating in our democracy. 

That's why I'm fighting alongside @RonWyden to allow for mail-in voting during public health crises like #COVID19

This is as confusing a time as we've ever been in.

It's important to remain calm, resilient, and aware.

When faced with challenges like this, our social responsibility is heavier. It falls on everyone in our community to act responsibly so we all remain healthy and safe.

Throughout it all, let's also remember to show consideration and empathy for those on the front lines keeping daily life together.

Health staff, grocery store workers, those in the service industry: you are appreciated.

This country is entering one of the most tumultuous economic periods in our history. While we must prioritize public health, I'm working on a plan to help workers and local businesses fight back against the economic damage being done by #COVID19

These Oregon-based physicians have a plan to mitigate the spread and consequences of #COVID19. I hope this administration will listen and take action.

https://t.co/CPWNDyMHXi
It is critical we all know the facts and what we should do. Oregonians should stay updated with the latest information on the Oregon Health Authority website: https://t.co/BhkgIctBbD 15/15

-Protect the courageous people keeping our communities safe. Frontline public health workers and those in contact with people that have been exposed should all have the equipment and protective gear they need. 13/15
-Provide comprehensive child care as more schools and daycare centers close as a result of the virus. 12/15

-Employers must also be required to provide paid sick leave, available immediately, in the event of a public health emergency. This includes missing work when your child‚Äôs school is closed or if you or a family member is quarantined or isolated as a result of the outbreak. 11/15

-Protect small businesses by reimbursing the costs of providing 14 days of additional paid sick leave. Hard hit small businesses should be able to provide their employees protections without going bankrupt. 10/15

-For those unemployed as a result of #COVID19, I‚Äôm working to secure benefits that would be available through the end of 2020 and can be paid retroactively. Importantly, Social Security trust funds must be held harmless. 9/15
-Halt student debt collections and provide relief while we deal with economic challenges brought on by #COVID19. 6/15
-A moratorium on evictions that could result from #COVID19. 5/15

This is what we need: 

-Free #COVID19 testing for everyone who needs a test, including the uninsured, regardless of income. 3/15

With all of the uncertainty surrounding #COVID19, I want to make sure you know what I‚Äôm fighting for in Washington D.C. 

There are some lessons I hope we have learned from other crises of the last two decades, like 9/11 and the 2008 financial crisis. 1/15
RT @RepPeterDeFazio: We need a coordinated effort between all levels of government to mitigate the impact of #Covid19. I've joined w/@SenJe‚Ä¶

#Covid_19 testing should be free.

Paid family and medical leave should be guaranteed. 

In the midst of a global health crisis, this should be common sense, and it will make a huge difference stabilizing the economy.
I have a bold vision to tackle climate change, address the housing crisis, and expand access to quality, affordable healthcare. Join me. https://t.co/eFBO7hhIc8

Enjoyed having lunch w/ members of the PDX Chinese American community to discuss ways we can fight racial discrimination amidst the #COVID19   outbreak. With all the disinformation circulating, it's important to continue patronizing AAPI businesses & keep our local economy strong https://t.co/vnuivXl25d

Congress is taking this seriously and dedicating the resources necessary to beat this crisis. 

We will be successful in keeping people safe, but events like this also sadly illustrate our second-rate executive leadership & the need for universal health care.

Yesterday I worked alongside others in the delegation to secure CDC funding to help fight the coronavirus in Oregon. The House and Senate also passed a funding package double what the Trump administration proposed to fight the virus nationwide.

As one of only 10 states w/ paid sick leave, in Oregon it's likely that you lawfully have the right to stay home & still be paid if you're unwell. If you think you're being denied that right, visit https://t.co/tyNHUoh0IG

Don't risk it‚Äîwe all play a role in staying healthy.

Despite what @realdonaldtrump says #coronavid19 is not a hoax. @OHAOregon recommends that you wash your hands often w/soap & water for 20 sec, cover coughs & sneezes w/a tissue, avoid touching your face, clean & disinfect surfaces, & stay home if you are sick. For info, call 211. https://t.co/IUKEBXzlEA

This crisis will prove to be an indictment of not only our executive leadership (or lackthereof), but our health care system as a whole. 

No more "Go Fund Me" health care. We need quality, affordable care‚Äîperiod. 

We need Medicare for All.

Trump has dismissed the severity of the coronavirus, cut budgets that would fund the response, & passed the responsibility to a man who has a track record of failed public health leadership. 

Now we hear stories of people being billed for care to keep the virus at bay.

Today‚Äôs anti-abortion votes in the Senate were part of a calculated and deliberate attack on reproductive rights. If Mitch McConnell and the @GOPSenate actually cared about women's reproductive health, they'd provide more access to care, not less.

All the new housing doesn't matter if the people who need it most are forced to spend another night on the streets. That's why I've introduced a bold plan to address this epidemic. It's time for a big change, for a new deal in housing the likes of which our country has never seen https://t.co/jBXG2mxL7S
RT @ChloeEudalyPDX: I was sickened by the story of Portland resident Michael Fesser who was the victim of racially motivated harassment, su‚Ä¶

RT @kimberlykindy: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs shameful that this is where we are at. These are sick, damaged animals,‚Äù 
@repblumenauer, a member of Congress‚Äôs A‚Ä¶

Americans will no longer be forced to pay twice as much for mediocre health care. It starts by making sure prescription drug price reform employs simple principles of competition, lowering skyrocketing costs.
The next administration will announce an end to the war against the Affordable Care Act and instead build and strengthen it, moving rapidly to expand health care to all!
We will reinstate important policies ensuring our communities have access to healthy food and providing it to all our children at little to no cost, so they are healthy and ready to learn.

I will #BoycottSOTU, but the crowd will be filled w/ people impacted most by Trump's policies & McConnell's shameful inaction. I gave my ticket to Michelle Freedman, a tireless advocate for lower Rx prices. Her experience is why we're fighting to improve the #StateOfHealthCare

The theme of the event: WE WON'T GO BACK! https://t.co/N7IAyU0DHi

I hope you get to spend your holiday with loved ones and that you are safe, warm, and healthy.

From my family to yours,
Earl https://t.co/6aAcL78WWn

This vote was a vote for progressive reform, for racial justice, for personal freedom, for economic opportunity, and for better health. #WeWantMORE

We must #CancelStudentDebt now, especially for low income students across the country.

Alabama's outrageous abortion ban is a full out attack on women's health, their fundamental freedoms, the constitution, and is part of a larger effort to overturn #RoeVWade. 

This decision is cruel, misogynistic, and misguided. We have to fight this like hell!

Today, Rep. Suzanne Bonamici and I welcomed Rep. Pramila Jayapal to a Medicare For All Speak Out because we are ALL better off when we‚Äôre ALL better off. #MedicareForAll #healthcareforalloregon #democraticsocialistsofamerica #democraticpartyhealthcaucus #healthcare4all https://t.co/s1v7ejDMik

-Universal, affordable health care

-lowering health care $$
-protecting voting rights
-ensuring women are paid equal pay for equal work
As we start work on the next 100 days,
it‚Äôs time for the Senate to act!

We need bold action. We need innovation. We need #MedicareForAll. https://t.co/Tflu98rJ4Q

At our community forum this evening, Oregonians will address skyrocketing cost of prescription drugs and what next steps will be taken. 

Affordable medicines are key to providing healthcare for all. Choosing between health and financial security must end.

The #TrumpBudget confirms what we already knew.

He cares little for the health and safety of Americans or the planet, but he cares a lot about wasteful spending and racist fear-mongering. https://t.co/7DGB9jWP8U

Today was the first step of many to #EndGunViolence by passing #HR8 for universal background checks. 

This movement has provided a better Congress & given us leadership that leads, instead of thoughts and prayers with no progress. We MUST treat this public health crisis.
